newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India shares flat ahead of holiday.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India shares flat ahead of holiday.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts finished virtually unchanged on Friday on scant volume as investors squared positions ahead of a long weekend in Britain, traders said.
Reports that the long-awaited hike in petroleum product prices would be agreed at a meeting on Sunday also depressed activity, traders said.
"People are reluctant to be long with the petroleum price rise expected and a day off on Monday," a trader said.
Disappointing earnings results from steel maker TISCO on Friday gave the market a negative cast, traders said.
The Bombay 30 share index lost 29.92 points to 3,700.86.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed 0.04 points down at 81.52, with the premium over the local market at 25.63 percent from 25.66 percent.
Tata Engineering & Locomotives enjoyed a good week, ending up around a dollar higher at $12.87/$13.87, as expectations of a positive earnings report on Tuesday gave buyers courage.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index rose 0.05 points, or 0.04 percent, to 114.48, representing a discount to the local market of 3.08 percent.
The Capel Korea GDR Index gained 0.91 points to 68.10 points, a premium of 40.39 percent over the local market.
